content.text:
This line of of myelinated axons in layer IV of visual cortex represents the axons of cells in the <image 1> 

A. Superior colliculus.
B. Lateral geniculate.
C. Retina.
D. Medial geniculate.

The image shows a cross-section of the brain, specifically highlighting a region with a dense bundle of myelinated axons. This structure is characteristic of the lateral geniculate nucleus (LGN), which is part of the thalamus and plays a crucial role in visual processing by relaying visual information from the retina to the primary visual cortex.

Given this context, the correct answer is:

B. Lateral geniculate.
Now, output the final answer and nothing else:
